name: Suite Duomo

reviews.title: Size isn't everything...
reviews.text: This hotel is above a huge McDonalds. Ferrara is a UNESCO world heritage town. You may not care, but for those more sensitive to such associations; if you are a Renaissance scholar or a romantic traveller with a romantic notion of Ferrara perhaps, then try staying at one of the quaint hotels around the centre. If the price leads you to Suite Duomo, demand a room at the front which faces the Cathedral. At least then, you will have a view and wont be woken up each morning before 7am by the most horrendous noise and tremors from the garbage trucks doing their business at the back lane behind McDonalds.

The room was huge, particularly by Italian standards. No attempt at Renaissance style, just modern cheapish fittings. I stayed 3 nights and my sheets were not changed. Tiled floors, and the kitchenette is inside a cupboard (no oven or microwave). Its all a bit sterile, but easy to keep clean. I had what was ironically and somewhat sacriligiously called the Isabella d'Este suite, no. 809. Don't stay there if the early morning noise would bother you and the ugly outlook. I hired a bicycle from a sweet old man two blocks away and that is the best advice I can give you for a stay in Ferrara. I even circumnavigated the ancient city walls. The young man on the desk here, was very genial and smiled a lot. Breakfast on the terrace is cute but dont try the orange juice which is cordial. There is a supermarket CONAD about 5 minutes walk. Use it, for there are not a lot of charming places to eat in Ferrara, you will be surprised. Even the locals agreed with me. Many places are closed for July/August. Suite Duomo would be a great idea for families and for budget minded people who do not expect stylish accommodation.
reviews.title: Suite Duomo and Ferrara
Suite Duomo ...... Absolutely Fabulous !
reviews.text: Fifteen of us spent two nights (14-15 June 2005), booking eight rooms at Suite Duomo, overlooking the Piazza Duomo in the historic center of Ferrara. We used Ferrara as a stopover (like most tourists) on our way from Zermatt to San Gimignano. This was either an unfortunate or fortunate decision on our part, depending on how you want to look at it. Unfortunately, we only stayed two nights; fortunately, we found a great hotel and a wonderful city to return to.

reviews.title: Loved the Suite Il Duomo and Ferrara in general
reviews.text: Since Suite Duomo is located in the heart of historic Ferrara, where traffic is limited, we had to park outside the city center. The parking lot was located just off the traffic circle on the main road from the autostrada after crossing the river. It was about a 5-10 minute walk to the hotel, and a bit of a haul with our luggage. When we checked out, we brought our cars to the hotel and loaded our luggage there. So, when arriving, it’s better to unload your luggage in front of the hotel and then find the parking lot.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While we enjoyed the many historic properties we stayed at during our recent trip to nothern Italy, this aggressively contemporary hotel was a pleasant break. Pluses included a spacious two-room suite (ideal if you're traveling wtih children), Jacuzzi water jets in the shower, kitchen facilities, and a superb location in the heart of the old part of the city with great views of the cathedral. The undulating hallways displaying contemporary artwork made an even bigger interior design statement than the furnishings of the room. (The pictures at the web site really capture the place.) Breakfast benefited both from a small terrace overlooking the cathedral square and a solid array of food options. If you are driving, as we were, an inexpensive and large public parking lot is a very few blocks away and you can drop your bags off at the hotel if you llike. I'll certainly stay there again if I'm lucky enough to get back to Ferrara (the aptly named city of bikes).
reviews.title: Fun, contemporary, and spacious

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had great hopes for the Suite Duomo after reading the reviews. When we arrived, the staff was curt and unhelpful, both in showing us to the room and in giving us recommendations for dinner that night. The hallway had an exotic smell that came from either mildew or a very strange cleanser. The room was large enough, with a huge bathroom by Italian standards, but there was a lot of noise from the piazza below, and we couldn't shut the window because we couldn't get the air conditioning to work. A portable fridge on the dresser had a fan that made so much noise it had to be unplugged. The next morning, the breakfast 'pastries' tasted like cardboard, and the eggs looked as if they had been out since the day before. And below it sits a McDonald's restaurant. This B&B had as much charm as its neighbor and the same level of quality. If you go to Italy to eat at a McDonald's, go to the Suite Duomo to get old world charm. Ferrara is a gorgeous city, and you owe it yourself to stay in a place that matches the city.
reviews.title: As much charm as the McDonald's below it

likes.disliked: — the ambiance, the staff and the breakfast

reviews.title: Wonderful experience
reviews.text: The Hotel Suite Duomo is a charming place to stay. The personnel is extremely helpful and friendly. Everyone was courteous. The apartment was modern and clean with many amenities. The apartment had a living area, kitchenette, bedroom and bathroom.

The location could not have been better. You are in the heart of the city. There are many places to dine within walking distance. Since it is a pedestrian only part of the city, it is pleasantly quiet. No annoying traffic noise like vespas. Parking is inexpensive and about 3 walking blocks away. Breakfast is served on the roof top terrace, which is very pleasant.
reviews.title: Incredible view, huge comfortable rooms, great staff, good price!!
Lovely Stay at Suite Duomo
reviews.text: I would recomment The Hotel Suite Duomo and would not hesitate to stay again.

Suite Duomo was a pleasant surprise. We were a little nervous at first when we found out it was above a "McDonalds", but the proximity to a chain restaurant did not deterr from our stay at all. The suites had all the amenities a traveller needs, plus, we had a wonderful view of the square. The staff were exceptional and the morning breakfast was good! Ask for a cappacino, they will make you one free of charge.
reviews.title: Great City, Great Hotel!

reviews.text: Ferrara is a really interesting little city.....it was a nice change from the extremely touristy cities such as Rome and Venice. There are lovely restaurants, wine bars and amazing shopping. Market stalls popped up all over, which made it even more fun. Plus, if you really want to see how the Italians live, this is the place to go. Wonderful!!!!

reviews.title: Small-town charm, but not at Suite Duomo
reviews.text: I recently returned from Ferrara and I have very fond memories of the Hotel Suite Duomo. I am an fine artist and have a high level of appreciation for beautiful surroundings and environments of historic value as well as modern cutting edge creations; I found an great example of this at the Suite Duomo. The hotel sits in the heart of the deeply historic Ferrara city center where important monuments like the Estense Castle are but a few steps away. It was amazing to literally walk out the front door into this uniquely blended city of the past and present. The hotel staff were always knowledgable and extremely helpful. I remember the first morning I looked at the continential breakfast and was pleasantly suprised at the vast array of choices from tasty pastries and cappuccinos to scrambled eggs and fresh Italian meats. I really enjoyed the the room I stayed in; I had a veiw of the center of the city and the rooms had a modern flare to them while not obtrusive to the historic nature of Ferrara. To top it off there is beautiful fine art selectively spread throughout Suite Duomo, that just adds to the existing beauty of the hotel itself. My stay was excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the Suite Duomo a great place to be in Ferrara. There is no driving permitted in the town; however you may proceed to the hotel and are given ample time to check the room, register and get the luggage stowed. Parking is a cinch...in a public town maintained lot a block from the hotel..a few euros for 24 hrs.....disregard the parking "attendants"; they disappear at the slightest discouragement.
reviews.title: Nice location, perfectly fine accommodation

likes.disliked: — smelly hallways, annoying missing amenities (soap), no internet
